action.action-desc: Mr. Walker introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To withhold United States contributions to the regularly assessed biennial budget of the United Nations until the United Nations adopts a definition of international terrorism concurrent with United States laws, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Define it to Fight it Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary of State shall withhold ten percent of United States contributions to the regularly assessed biennial budget of the United Nations until such time as the United Nations adopts a definition of international terrorism that is concurrent with United States laws.
Contributions withheld pursuant to subsection (a) shall be returned to the general fund of the Treasury to be used for debt reduction purposes.

paragraph.text: The term international terrorism means terrorism involvingâ€”

subparagraph.text: one or more citizens of a country; or
the territory of one or more countries,

paragraph.continuation-text: if the government of any such country consents to, or with knowledge, allows, tolerates, or disregards the activities of any such citizen or such use of the territory of any such country, including using such territory as a transit point.

paragraph.text: The term terrorism means premeditated, politically motivated violence perpetrated against noncombatant targets by an individual, subnational group, or clandestine agent, and includes activities relating to terrorism, including training, fund-raising, financing, or recruitment.
The term territory means the land, water, or airspace of a country.
